title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http:contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: Sotkanet API R tools
text: Release version CRAN: Development version GitHub:

title: Sotkanet API R tools
text: Load sotkanet libraries used vignette List available Sotkanet indicators: List geographical regions available indicators:
code: # Using a pre-defined list of indicators for a smaller download sotkanet.indicators <- SotkanetIndicators(id = c(4,5,6,7,46,74), type = "table") kable(head(sotkanet.indicators)) # options(width = 60) sotkanet.regions <- SotkanetRegions(type = "table") kable(head(sotkanet.regions))

title: Sotkanet API R tools
text: Get indicator . 10013 (Unemployment rate young people aged 16-24 years) Sotkanet, Finland (Suomi) 1990-2012 (Eurostat employment statistics youth unemployment), plot graph:
code: # Get indicator data dat <- GetDataSotkanet(indicators = 10013, years = 1990:2012,                     genders = c('female', 'male', 'total'),                 region.category = "EUROOPPA", regions = "Suomi")  # Investigate the first lines in the data kable(head(dat)) %>%    kable_styling() %>%   kableExtra::scroll_box(width = "100%")

title: Sotkanet API R tools
text: Download visualize time series:  Investigate effect municipality size demographic variation. Smaller municipalities show random variation expected statistical arguments:
code: # Pick indicator name indicator.name <- as.character(unique(dat$indicator.title.fi)) indicator.source <- as.character(unique(dat$indicator.organization.title.fi))  # Visualize library(ggplot2) theme_set(theme_bw(20));  p <- ggplot(dat, aes(x = year, y = primary.value, group = gender, color = gender))  p <- p + geom_line() + ggtitle(paste(indicator.name, indicator.source, sep = " / "))  p <- p + labs(x = "Year", y = "Value", caption = "Data source: https://sotkanet.fi") p <- p + theme(title = element_text(size = 10)) p <- p + theme(axis.title.x = element_text(size = 20)) p <- p + theme(axis.title.y = element_text(size = 20)) p <- p + theme(legend.title = element_text(size = 15)) print(p) selected.inds <- c(127, 178) dat <- GetDataSotkanet(indicators = selected.inds,                  years = 2011, genders = c('total')) # Pick necessary fields and remove duplicates datf <- dat[, c("region.title.fi", "indicator.title.fi", "primary.value")] datf <- datf[!duplicated(datf),] dw <- reshape(datf, idvar = "region.title.fi",                  timevar = "indicator.title.fi", direction = "wide") names(dw) <- c("Municipality", "Population", "Migration") p <- ggplot(dw, aes(x = log10(Population), y = Migration)) +        geom_point(size = 3)        ggtitle("Migration vs. population size")  #> $title #> [1] "Migration vs. population size" #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "labels"        theme(title = element_text(size = 15)) #> List of 1 #>  $ title:List of 11 #>   ..$ family       : NULL #>   ..$ face         : NULL #>   ..$ colour       : NULL #>   ..$ size         : num 15 #>   ..$ hjust        : NULL #>   ..$ vjust        : NULL #>   ..$ angle        : NULL #>   ..$ lineheight   : NULL #>   ..$ margin       : NULL #>   ..$ debug        : NULL #>   ..$ inherit.blank: logi FALSE #>   ..- attr(*, "class")= chr [1:2] "element_text" "element" #>  - attr(*, "class")= chr [1:2] "theme" "gg" #>  - attr(*, "complete")= logi FALSE #>  - attr(*, "validate")= logi TRUE        theme(axis.title.x = element_text(size = 20)) #> List of 1 #>  $ axis.title.x:List of 11 #>   ..$ family       : NULL #>   ..$ face         : NULL #>   ..$ colour       : NULL #>   ..$ size         : num 20 #>   ..$ hjust        : NULL #>   ..$ vjust        : NULL #>   ..$ angle        : NULL #>   ..$ lineheight   : NULL #>   ..$ margin       : NULL #>   ..$ debug        : NULL #>   ..$ inherit.blank: logi FALSE #>   ..- attr(*, "class")= chr [1:2] "element_text" "element" #>  - attr(*, "class")= chr [1:2] "theme" "gg" #>  - attr(*, "complete")= logi FALSE #>  - attr(*, "validate")= logi TRUE        theme(axis.title.y = element_text(size = 20)) #> List of 1 #>  $ axis.title.y:List of 11 #>   ..$ family       : NULL #>   ..$ face         : NULL #>   ..$ colour       : NULL #>   ..$ size         : num 20 #>   ..$ hjust        : NULL #>   ..$ vjust        : NULL #>   ..$ angle        : NULL #>   ..$ lineheight   : NULL #>   ..$ margin       : NULL #>   ..$ debug        : NULL #>   ..$ inherit.blank: logi FALSE #>   ..- attr(*, "class")= chr [1:2] "element_text" "element" #>  - attr(*, "class")= chr [1:2] "theme" "gg" #>  - attr(*, "complete")= logi FALSE #>  - attr(*, "validate")= logi TRUE        theme(legend.title = element_text(size = 15)) #> List of 1 #>  $ legend.title:List of 11 #>   ..$ family       : NULL #>   ..$ face         : NULL #>   ..$ colour       : NULL #>   ..$ size         : num 15 #>   ..$ hjust        : NULL #>   ..$ vjust        : NULL #>   ..$ angle        : NULL #>   ..$ lineheight   : NULL #>   ..$ margin       : NULL #>   ..$ debug        : NULL #>   ..$ inherit.blank: logi FALSE #>   ..- attr(*, "class")= chr [1:2] "element_text" "element" #>  - attr(*, "class")= chr [1:2] "theme" "gg" #>  - attr(*, "complete")= logi FALSE #>  - attr(*, "validate")= logi TRUE print(p)

title: Sotkanet API R tools
text: takes long time recommended regular use. Save data local disk work.
code: # These indicators have problems with R routines: problematic.indicators <- c(1575, 1743, 1826, 1861, 1882, 1924, 1952, 2000,                              2001, 2033, 2050, 3386, 3443)  # Get data for all indicators datlist <- list() for (ind in setdiff(sotkanet.indicators$indicator, problematic.indicators)) {   datlist[[as.character(ind)]] <- GetDataSotkanet(indicators = ind,          years = 1990:2013, genders = c('female', 'male', 'total')) }  # Combine tables (this may require considerable time and memory  # for the full data set) dat <- do.call("rbind", datlist)

title: Sotkanet API R tools
text: usage examples, see rOpenGov-blog, takomo, Helsinki Region Infoshare-blog

title: Sotkanet API R tools
text: Cite SOTKAnet link https://sotkanet.fi/sotkanet/fi/index. Also mention indicator provider. Full license terms use. Central points: SOTKAnet REST API meant non-regular data queries. Avoid regular repeated downloads. SOTKAnet API can used basis systems Metadata regions indicators CC-4.0 THL indicators CC-4.0 Indicators provided third parties can used separate agreement!

title: sotkanet R package
text: R package access manipulate data Sotkanet demographics indicator database. Sotkanet data portal provides 2000 demographic indicators across Finland Europe, maintained National Institute Health Welfare (THL). information, see data description.

title: sotkanet R package
text: can install stable release version CRAN: Alternatively, can install development version sotkanet package GitHub :

title: sotkanet R package
text: Load package R: List available indicators Sotkanet data portal: example data retrieval visualization, using indicator describing private dental care use among 0-17 years old 2015-2020.  -depth examples, see package vignette online tutorial page.
code: library(sotkanet) # Pre-defined list of indicators to save bandwidth sotkanet.indicators <- SotkanetIndicators(c(4,5,6,7,46,74)) head(sotkanet.indicators$indicator.title.fi) #> [1] "Mielenterveyden häiriöihin sairaalahoitoa saaneet 0 - 17-vuotiaat / 1 000 vastaavanikäistä"              #> [2] "Toimeentulotukea saaneet 25 - 64-vuotiaat, % vastaavanikäisestä väestöstä"                               #> [3] "Somaattisen erikoissairaanhoidon vuodeosastohoitopäivät 75 vuotta täyttäneillä / 1 000 vastaavanikäistä" #> [4] "0 - 6-vuotiaat, % väestöstä"                                                                             #> [5] "0 - 6-vuotiaat, % väestöstä, väestöennuste 2060"                                                         #> [6] "Yhden vanhemman perheet, % lapsiperheistä" library(ggplot2) library(ggrepel)  hammashoito <- GetDataSotkanet(indicators = 1075, years = 2015:2020, genders = "total", region.category = "MAAKUNTA")  # Indicator title tells what this indicator is about unique(hammashoito$indicator.title.fi) #> [1] "Yksityisen hammashuollon käynnit 0 - 17-vuotiailla / 1 000 vastaavanikäistä"  # Some data has to be retrieved separately hammashoito_metadata <- SotkanetIndicatorMetadata(id = 1075)  plot_caption <- paste0("Lähde: https://sotkanet.fi / ", hammashoito_metadata$organization$title$fi, "\n",                        "Datan päiväys ", hammashoito_metadata$`data-updated`)  plot <- ggplot(hammashoito, aes(x=year, y=primary.value, group=region.title.fi))+   geom_line(aes(color=region.title.fi)) +   geom_point(aes(color=region.title.fi))  plot + labs(title = "Yksityisen hammashuollon käynnit 2015-2020",             subtitle = "0 - 17-vuotiailla / 1 000 vastaavanikäistä",             x = "Vuosi",              y = "Käyntien lkm",             caption = plot_caption,             color = "Maakunta") +   geom_text_repel(     aes(color = region.title.fi, label = ifelse(year == 2020, region.title.fi, NA_character_)),     xlim = c(2021, 2023),     direction = "both",     hjust = 0,     segment.size = .7,     segment.alpha = .5,     segment.linetype = "dotted",     box.padding = .4,     segment.curvature = -0.1,     segment.ncp = 3,     segment.angle = 20) +   theme(legend.position = "none",         panel.background = element_rect(fill = "linen")) +   scale_x_continuous(     expand = c(0, 0),     limits = c(2015, 2022),      breaks = seq(2015, 2020)) #> Warning: Removed 95 rows containing missing values (geom_text_repel). #> Warning: ggrepel: 2 unlabeled data points (too many overlaps). Consider #> increasing max.overlaps

title: Retrieve Sotkanet Data — GetDataSotkanet
text: Retrieve selected data combine single table.

title: Retrieve Sotkanet Data — GetDataSotkanet
code: GetDataSotkanet(   indicators = NULL,   years = 1991:2015,   genders = c("total"),   regions = NULL,   region.category = NULL,   user.agent = NULL )

title: Retrieve Sotkanet Data — GetDataSotkanet
text: indicators Dataset identifier(s) years vector years c(2010, 2012, ... ) genders vector genders ('male' | 'female' | 'total') regions filter selected regions (default: regions) region.category filter one following 14 valid  regions categories (default: categories) "ALUEHALLINTOVIRASTO" "ELY-KESKUS" "ERVA" "EURALUEET" (Eurozone) "EUROOPPA" (Europe) "HYVINVOINTIALUE" (welfare country) "KUNTA" (municipality) "MAA" (country) "MAAKUNTA" (region) "NUTS1" "POHJOISMAAT" (Nordic countries) "SAIRAANHOITOPIIRI (hospital district) "SEUTUKUNTA" "SUURALUE" user.agent "User agent" defined user. Default NULL use package identifier "rOpenGov/sotkanet"

title: Retrieve Sotkanet Data — GetDataSotkanet
text: data.frame

what: sotkanet: Sotkanet Open Data Access and Analysis — sotkanet-package
title: sotkanet: Sotkanet Open Data Access and Analysis — sotkanet-package
text: `sotkanet` R package aims make retrieval sotkanet     indicator data easy using R. Sotkanet.fi Statistics Indicator Bank    maintained Finnish Institute Health Welfare    contains data population welfare health 1990 onwards.

title: sotkanet: Sotkanet Open Data Access and Analysis — sotkanet-package
text: main ways interact Sotkanet REST API    following functions: GetDataSotkanet downloading data     specific indicator(s), SotkanetIndicators     retrieving metadata user specified indicators well     defined list SotkanetIndicatorMetadata     specialized case returning untruncated ("raw") output default.

title: sotkanet: Sotkanet Open Data Access and Analysis — sotkanet-package
text: citing package, see citation("sotkanet") terms use Sotkanet data, see THL     Sotkanet REST API     documentation (Finnish). short unofficial English summary Finnish Terms use    follows: end user package note metadata related regional classifications indicators       released Creative       Commons Attribution 4.0 license (CC 4.0), statistical data indicators produced THL       likewise released CC 4.0 license, statistical data indicators produced parties       THL used accordance separate agreement. CC 4.0 terms state using data accessed sotkanet     API always give appropriate credit Sotkanet data     source include link sotkanet website: https://sotkanet.fi.     case individual indicators, producer indicator     also attributed separately. information subject change developers package    guarantee information stated correct. unofficial    English translation related data terms use provided solely    convenience end user. user package always     check full text Sotkanet terms use original source     (see link Sotkanet REST API documentation).

title: sotkanet 0.9.79 (2022-02-01)
text: CRAN release: 2022-02-01

title: sotkanet 0.9.79 (2022-02-01)
text: Functions pointing external resources (sotkanet.json_query() sotkanet.csv_query()) now fail gracefully. New internal functions R/http_funs.R New dependencies / imports: httr package handling URLs error messages curl package internet connection testing. jsonlite handling data json files Http functions now include information user agent. default “rOpenGov/sotkanet” help API providers track package usage can changed relevant functions: GetDataSotkanet(), SotkanetIndicators() SotkanetRegions().

title: sotkanet 0.9.79 (2022-02-01)
text: Removed internal functions: GetDataSotkanetSingleIndicator SotkanetData. Removed dependency / import: rjson Deleted unused function: base_url

title: sotkanet 0.9.79 (2022-02-01)
text: Functionalities GetDataSotkanetSingleIndicator SotkanetData now embedded one function, GetDataSotkanet(). files ./R/ folder renamed better legibility: internal.R SotkanetCollect.R sotkanet.R SotkanetRegions.R New alias downloading indicator metadata: SotkanetIndicatorMetadata() (usesSotkanetIndicator(id)) help save bandwidth, provided predefined list indicators, SotkanetIndicators() now downloads metadata individually instead fetching subsetting whole indicator dataset. Vignette longer fetch external resources CRAN. Package license clarified: BSD 2-clause instead FreeBSD

title: sotkanet 0.9.76 (2021-04-29)
text: CRAN release: 2021-05-03 Adding rmarkdown Suggests Minor fixes CRAN submission (broken URLs etc.) NEWS.md template updated pkgdown-specifications
